text.p: NOTE - Uniwear is a Belgian textile holding company. Turnover was boosted in 1996 following the acquisition in January of a stake in U.K. hosiery manufacturer and distributor Pex Plc.

By end-December 1996 the number of Uniwear shares had increased to 1,908,923 from 1,571,840 a year earlier following a capital increase. In March this year Uniwear made a further capital increase of 288 million francs.
Pex made a net profit of 24.5 million francs after a previous 116.1 million loss, with productivity boosted by new machines.
Profit at New Zealand unit Rock United Ltd edged up to 6.5 million francs from 6.1 million, and at Belgian linen unit Lys Lieve it rose to 0.4 million from 0.2 million.
